p: When controls were used as a reference for imputation DAM, a consistent bias against the risk allele was observed for all three diseases. For example, when the major allele was the risk allele, integer imputation was biased toward the minor allele ( p < 10 −7 for each disease) and when the minor allele was the risk allele, imputation was biased toward the major allele ( p < 10 −15 for each disease). Similar results were observed when fractional imputation was used.
